content.content: I have a hard time judging how much support Rune’s End Game plan has. This informal poll is completely anonymous, and is mostly to estimate the level of support End Game has when people can express their thoughts freely. I will set the poll to the same trust level as a signal.    Do you support the End Game Plan?  Yes No Abstain     0 voters     This is an informal poll and no action will be taken as a result.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is conducting an informal poll to estimate the level of support for Rune's End Game plan. The post asks readers to express their thoughts freely and vote on whether they support the plan or not. The author clarifies that this is an anonymous poll and that no action will be taken as a result.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: Thank you for designing this poll
I think that in the face of everything described by @rune and others, this poll sets a precedent for what people really want, however in the end the votes go to the MKR Holders.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: A lot of abstentions! I guess those people are waiting for the final draft to make up their mind?
This has been really informative! I had no idea it was so evenly split. Thanks everyone! I’ll definitely have to keep digging in

One point that’s become apparent is that there is so to End-Game that it’s very difficult to be able to definitively say ‘yes I support this’ or ‘no, I don’t support this’ to the plan as a whole. The other part is that only half the plan has been published in written form at this point. There may be a good few people that are reserving judgement until they’ve seen all of it.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: It is one of the few governance surveys in which abstention can be justified. The action plan for it in itself although written is super complicated to understand or develop in the minds of many Maker users.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match
None of the topics listed match

content.content: The Plan needs to be simplified, shortened and compressed to what is really important, the concise and precise changes that are proposed to be made, because otherwise, at the moment of truth, few delegates or voters will participate in the election, of course, when the Plan is complete.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: It is good that everyone in the forum participates in this vote, so we really know the feeling of the community, in general we can not progress in ideas without finding a balance between all of them.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Rob:  A lot of abstentions! I guess those people are waiting for the final draft to make up their mind   I voted to abstain, and think that doing so is logical at this point in time. as LFW writes above, it’s extremely hard to commit to ‘supporting’ the Endgame Plan when different parts of that plan (some with potentially seismic consequences for how Maker functions) are still to be fleshed out. I worry a little bit that several delegates have committed wholeheartedly to executing the Endgame Plan without a clear picture of what the full plan involves or what it looks like in practice.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
